results.creator_credit: James Hanlon, Gedeon Naudet, Jules Naudet, Ian Paisley, Paul la Rosa, Silverstar Productions and Goldfish Pictures
results.brief_description: Two filmmaking brothers set out to make an documentary about the New York Fire Department following a trainee’s development to working at a fire station. The fire station they cover turns out to be one of the closest to the World Trade Centre and what evolves is the most gripping and terrifying footage of the terrorist attack on 9th September 2001. How this event affects the firemen, filmmakers and people of New York, is shown by a mixture of actual footage and interviews. Directed by Jules and Gedeon Naudet and James Hanlon. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: 8MMM Aboriginal Radio
results.brief_description: A TV series based at the fictitious 8MMM Aboriginal Radio station – the three M’s standing for the three categories of whitefellas who are drawn to the place – missionaries, mercenaries and misfits.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: A TV series based at the fictitious 8MMM Aboriginal Radio station – the three M’s standing for the three categories of whitefellas who are drawn to the place – missionaries, mercenaries and misfits.

results.title: 88.9 Radio Redfern
results.creator_credit: Geoff Burton, Sharon Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Radio Redfern is an inner-city Sydney public radio station which is run by Aboriginal people and their communities. In January 1988 while “gubbas” (white Australians) were celebrating the 200th anniversary of the invasion of Aboriginal Australia, Radio Redfern ran a twenty-four hour service which aimed to bring Aboriginal communities throughout Australia together to protest both the destructive effects of 200 years of European colonialism, and to celebrate the strength, dignity and resistance of Aboriginal culture. Using a rich soundtrack of Koori contemporary music this documentary is a testament to the diversity of contemporary black culture, and to Aboriginal unity around such issues as land rights and black deaths in custody.

results.title: 88 down under
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A promotional film for the Bicentenary celebrations which sets out to show the diversity of Australia, its history, wealth, cities, tourist attractions and above all its people and their achievements. Narrated in the style of the Paul Hogan tourist commercials.

results.title: 84 Charing Cross Road
results.creator_credit: David Jones, Geoffrey Helman and Brooksfilms
results.brief_description: Feisty Helen Hanff (Anne Bancroft) just loves rare books, the sort you can’t get in New York. Little does she know that a letter to a small second-hand bookshop in London will lead to a twenty year love affair with the staff and the city. Helen strikes up a particularly affectionate correspondence with Frank Doel (Anthony Hopkins) at Marks & Co. in ‘84 Charing Cross Road. Her letters are soon followed by food parcels to the food-rationed staff, and insights into life across the Atlantic. A heartwarming, charming film based upon the memoirs of Helen Hanff and the play adapted from her book.

results.title: 800 miles of winter (TEFC)
results.brief_description: From the discovery of oil at Prudhoe Bay in 1968 to the loading of the first tankers at Valdez in 1977, this is the story of one of the most difficult and costly construction projects ever attempted. Almost 800 miles of big pipe was laid across three major mountain ranges and Arctic perma-frost, to reach an ice free port in south east Alaska. (Award: Golden Eagle, USA)

results.title: 80 channels under the sea
results.creator_credit: Max Lemon, Ted Holliday and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: Tells in simple terms, the story of the manufacture and laying of the first stage of the Commonwealth Pacific Cable across the Tasman Sea between Bondi and Auckland and the advantages that this new 80 channel coaxial submarine cable will bring: high quality, trouble free telephone, telegraph, telex-leased teleprinter, photo-telegraph and broadcast services between Australia, North America, Britain and Europe.

results.title: 8 Women = 8 Femmes
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Mars Films, France 2 Cinema and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: A homage to accomplished French actresses, Francois Ozon has conjured a musical/comedy/mystery film featuring an ensemble cast of 8 women snowed in in a French residence in the 1950s investigating the murder of the only man in the house - Marcel. Gaby (Catherine Deneuve), his gold digging and emotionally distant wife; eldest daughter Suzon (Virginie Ledoyen) who has returned home for Christmas; youngest daughter Catherine (Ludivine Sagnier); mother in law Mamy (Danielle Darrieux) a wheelchair bound alcoholic supported by Marcel, along with his sister in law Augustine (Isabelle Huppert) a repressed hypochondriac jealous of anyone more sexual than her, including new chamber maid and Marcel’s lover, Louise (Emmanuelle Beart) and Marcel’s sister, exotic dancer Pierette (Fanny Ardant). The 8 is completed by maid Chanel (Firmine Richard). Under the pressure of one another’s accusations and confined to the sumptuous and sterile indoor settings, secrets are revealed over the space of an evening as the women play Miss Marples in this savvy, satirical, musical “thriller”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Mars Films, France 2 Cinema and Fidelite Productions
